(52) 54 of the27th February I informed my colleagues of the arrangements which had been agreed with the United States Government fortransmitting the text of the proposed warning statement to be issued after the signature of an armistice in Korea to the Secretary-general in a joint communication from the Permanent Representatives ofthe signatory Governments at United Nations Headquarters.The proposal for a joint communication proved unacceptable to the South African Government. The Governments concerned have therefore agreed to a change of procedure: there will no nojoint communication, but individual Governments will be free toinform the Secretary-General of their signature of the warningstatement if they wish. Her Majesty's Government in the UnitedKingdom will wish to inform the Secretary-General, as they attach importance to associating the United Nations with the warningstatement in this way.The arrangements for signature of the warning statementremain as set out in my memorandum of 27th February.A.E.Foreign Office, S. W. 1. ,23RD JUNE, 1952.
